metadata.title: CVE-2023-2177 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A null pointer dereference issue was found in the sctp network protocol innet/sctp/stream_sched.c in Linux Kernel. If stream_in allocation is failed,stream_out is freed which would further be accessed. A local user could usethis flaw to crash the system or potentially cause a denial of service.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
